meanings.definition: The act of buying something.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 购买某物的行为。

examples.english: I made a purchase online.
examples.chinese: 我在网上进行了购买。

examples.english: This purchase exceeded my budget.
examples.chinese: 这次购买超出了我的预算。

meanings.definition: To buy something.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 购买某物。

examples.english: I will purchase a new phone tomorrow.
examples.chinese: 我明天会购买一部新手机。

examples.english: He purchased a car last month.
examples.chinese: 他上个月买了一辆车。

meanings.definition: Not changing or varying; uniform; regular.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 不变的，持续的。

examples.english: The temperature remained constant throughout the day.
examples.chinese: 气温一整天都保持恒定。

examples.english: Her constant support helped me succeed.
examples.chinese: 她持续的支持帮助我成功。

meanings.definition: A situation or state of affairs that does not change.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 不会改变的状况或事务。

examples.english: In mathematics, pi is a well-known constant.
examples.chinese: 在数学中，π是众所周知的常数。

examples.english: Time was the one constant in his schedule.
examples.chinese: 在他的日程安排中，时间是唯一不变的因素。

meanings.definition: A state of minimal activity or rest.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 处于最低活动或休眠的状态。

examples.english: Many seeds require a period of dormancy to germinate.
examples.chinese: 许多种子需要一个休眠期才能发芽。

examples.english: Bears go into dormancy during winter.
examples.chinese: 熊在冬天会进入冬眠状态。

meanings.definition: Special or specific; distinct from others.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 特殊的或具体的；区别于其他的。

examples.english: I have a particular interest in modern art.
examples.chinese: 我对现代艺术有特别的兴趣。

examples.english: She is very particular about her coffee.
examples.chinese: 她对咖啡非常讲究。

meanings.definition: An individual item, fact, or detail.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 个别项目、事实或细节。

examples.english: We need all the particulars of the agreement.
examples.chinese: 我们需要协议的所有细节。

examples.english: Check each particular before making a conclusion.
examples.chinese: 在得出结论之前要核对每一个细节。

meanings.definition: A payment for consecutive issues of a publication or service.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 为连续出版物或服务支付的费用。

examples.english: I renewed my magazine subscription for another year.
examples.chinese: 我将杂志订阅续订了一年。

examples.english: The streaming service subscription is billed monthly.
examples.chinese: 这个流媒体服务的订阅费是按月收取的。

meanings.definition: The level or degree of intensity of a sound or activity.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 声音或活动的音调或强度。

examples.english: Her pitch during the presentation was very persuasive.
examples.chinese: 她在演示时的话语力度非常有说服力。

examples.english: The pitch of the note was too high for me to sing.
examples.chinese: 这个音调对我来说太高了，无法唱出来。

meanings.definition: To throw or fling roughly or casually.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 随意或粗略地投掷或抛掷。

examples.english: He pitched the ball over the fence.
examples.chinese: 他将球扔过了围栏。

examples.english: They pitched their idea to the investors.
examples.chinese: 他们向投资者推销了他们的想法。

meanings.definition: To give someone the right to do or have something.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 赋予某人做某事或拥有某物的权利。

examples.english: This ticket entitles you to a free drink.
examples.chinese: 这张票可以让你免费获得一杯饮品。

examples.english: Being a member entitles you to access special events.
examples.chinese: 成为会员可让你参加特别活动。

meanings.definition: A hinged cover or screen for a window or camera lens.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 用于窗户或相机镜头的铰链式盖子或屏。

examples.english: We closed the shutters to keep out the light.
examples.chinese: 我们关上了百叶窗以挡住光线。

examples.english: The camera shutter opened and closed quickly.
examples.chinese: 相机的快门迅速开合。

meanings.definition: To close or cover with shutters.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 用百叶窗关闭或覆盖。

examples.english: They decided to shutter all the windows before the storm.
examples.chinese: 在暴风雨来临前他们决定把所有窗户都关上。

examples.english: He shuttered the shop and went home.
examples.chinese: 他关了店铺的门板然后回家了。

meanings.definition: To destroy or ruin (a building or structure), especially on purpose.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 有意破坏或拆毁（建筑或结构）。

examples.english: They plan to demolish the old stadium to build a new one.
examples.chinese: 他们计划拆除旧体育场来建一个新的。

examples.english: The house was demolished within a day.
examples.chinese: 那座房子在一天之内就被拆除了。

meanings.definition: Able to withstand wear, pressure, or damage; hard-wearing.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 能承受磨损、压力或破坏；耐用的。

examples.english: These boots are very durable and last for years.
examples.chinese: 这些靴子非常耐用，可以穿好几年。

examples.english: We need a durable material for this construction.
examples.chinese: 我们需要一种耐用的材料来进行这项建造。

meanings.definition: To deal effectively with a difficult situation.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 有效地应对困难情况。

examples.english: She coped well with the unexpected change.
examples.chinese: 她很好地应对了意外的变化。

examples.english: He finds it hard to cope with stress.
examples.chinese: 他觉得很难应对压力。

meanings.definition: Movement to and fro or around something, especially of fluid in a closed system.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 来回或围绕某物的运动，尤其指在封闭系统中的流动。

examples.english: Blood circulation is crucial for staying healthy.
examples.chinese: 血液循环对于保持健康至关重要。

examples.english: Open the windows to improve air circulation.
examples.chinese: 打开窗户以改善空气流通。

meanings.definition: The transmission of customs or beliefs from generation to generation.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 在世代之间传递的习俗或信仰。

examples.english: It’s a family tradition to eat together on Sundays.
examples.chinese: 星期天一起吃饭是我们家的传统。

examples.english: They follow the tradition of lighting lanterns during the festival.
examples.chinese: 他们在节日期间遵循点灯的传统。

meanings.definition: An advantage or profit gained from something.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 从某事获得的好处或利润。

examples.english: He received many benefits from his new job.
examples.chinese: 他从新工作中获得了很多好处。

examples.english: The main benefit of this product is its durability.
examples.chinese: 这个产品的主要好处是它的耐用性。

meanings.definition: To receive an advantage; to profit or gain.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 获得优势、利润或收益。

examples.english: Children benefit greatly from regular exercise.
examples.chinese: 孩子们从经常运动中获益良多。

examples.english: The entire team benefited from the new policy.
examples.chinese: 整个团队都从新政策中受益。

meanings.definition: The state or process of rotting or decomposition.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 腐烂或分解的状态或过程。

examples.english: Tooth decay is common among children.
examples.chinese: 蛀牙在儿童中很常见。

examples.english: The abandoned house fell into decay.
examples.chinese: 那座废弃的房子逐渐腐朽。

meanings.definition: To rot or decompose through the action of bacteria or fungi.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 在细菌或真菌的作用下腐烂或分解。

examples.english: Fallen leaves decay on the forest floor.
examples.chinese: 落叶在森林地面上腐烂。

examples.english: Food left out will quickly decay.
examples.chinese: 放置在外的食物会很快腐烂。

meanings.definition: The action of sharing something out among a number of recipients.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 在一群接受者之间分发某物的行为。

examples.english: The distribution of supplies was handled by volunteers.
examples.chinese: 物资的分发由志愿者负责。

examples.english: The company managed the distribution of goods globally.
examples.chinese: 这家公司管理了货物在全球的分配。

meanings.definition: A shortcoming, imperfection, or lack.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 缺点、不完善或缺乏。

examples.english: The car was recalled due to a manufacturing defect.
examples.chinese: 这款汽车因为制造缺陷被召回。

examples.english: They found a minor defect in the product design.
examples.chinese: 他们发现了产品设计中的一个小缺陷。

meanings.definition: To abandon a country or cause, often to join an opposing one.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 放弃一个国家或事业，通常是加入对立的一方。

examples.english: He decided to defect to the rival faction.
examples.chinese: 他决定倒戈到竞争派别。

examples.english: Several members defected when they disagreed with the policy.
examples.chinese: 一些成员在对政策不满时选择了叛离。

meanings.definition: To disagree with and attempt to prevent, especially in argument or action.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 不同意并试图阻止，尤其是在争论或行动中。

examples.english: They oppose the new policy due to its cost.
examples.chinese: 他们反对这项新政策，因为它的费用过高。

examples.english: Many citizens opposed the construction of the highway.
examples.chinese: 许多市民反对修建这条高速公路。

meanings.definition: The practice or science of collecting and analyzing numerical data in large quantities.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 收集和分析大量数字数据的实践或科学。

examples.english: He is studying statistics at the university.
examples.chinese: 他在大学学习统计学。

examples.english: Statistics help us make informed decisions.
examples.chinese: 统计数据帮助我们做出明智的决定。

meanings.definition: Lacking fresh air or ventilation; also can mean dull or boring.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 缺乏新鲜空气或通风；也可指枯燥乏味。

examples.english: It’s quite stuffy in this room.
examples.chinese: 这间房间里空气很闷。

examples.english: The office felt stuffy without open windows.
examples.chinese: 没有开窗的办公室让人感觉很闷。

meanings.definition: Used to show that something is almost, but not completely, accurate or exact.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 表示某件事几乎但不完全精确。

examples.english: The journey took approximately three hours.
examples.chinese: 这次旅程大约花了三小时。

examples.english: The cost is approximately the same as last time.
examples.chinese: 花费与上次差不多。

meanings.definition: Able to be justified or forgiven; pardonable.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 能够被原谅或宽恕的。

examples.english: Being late once might be excusable, but not repeatedly.
examples.chinese: 迟到一次或许情有可原，但不能总是迟到。

examples.english: His mistake was deemed excusable under the circumstances.
examples.chinese: 在那种情况下，他的错误被认为是可原谅的。

meanings.definition: To suggest a plan or action.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 提出一个计划或行动。

examples.english: I propose we take a break for lunch.
examples.chinese: 我建议我们休息一下去吃午饭。

examples.english: She proposed a new design for the website.
examples.chinese: 她为网站提出了一个新的设计方案。

meanings.definition: A thing used to make something look more attractive.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 用来装饰某物使其更美观的物品。

examples.english: She placed several ornaments on the Christmas tree.
examples.chinese: 她在圣诞树上挂了好几个装饰品。

examples.english: The vase was just an ornament on the shelf.
examples.chinese: 那个花瓶只是架子上的一个装饰品。

meanings.definition: To make something look more attractive by adding decorative items.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 通过添加装饰物品使某物更具美感。

examples.english: They ornamented the living room with fresh flowers.
examples.chinese: 他们用鲜花来装饰客厅。

examples.english: She ornamented the cake with chocolate shavings.
examples.chinese: 她用巧克力碎片装饰了蛋糕。

meanings.definition: Showing or involving great activity or vitality.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 表现出或包含活力且富有能量的。

examples.english: The kids are always energetic in the morning.
examples.chinese: 孩子们在早上总是精力充沛。

examples.english: She gave an energetic performance on stage.
examples.chinese: 她在舞台上的表演充满活力。

meanings.definition: Relating to the atmosphere of the earth or another planet.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 与地球或其他行星大气层相关的。

examples.english: Atmospheric pressure changes can affect the weather.
examples.chinese: 大气压的变化会影响天气。

examples.english: They studied atmospheric composition on Mars.
examples.chinese: 他们研究了火星的大气成分。

meanings.definition: Involving mutual assistance in working toward a common goal.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 在共同目标下相互协作和帮助的。

examples.english: They have a cooperative approach to problem-solving.
examples.chinese: 他们用合作的方式解决问题。

examples.english: A cooperative attitude is essential for team projects.
examples.chinese: 团队项目需要合作的态度。

meanings.definition: A farm, business, or other organization that is owned and run jointly by its members.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 由其成员共同拥有和经营的农场、企业或其他组织形式。

examples.english: They formed a cooperative to market their produce.
examples.chinese: 他们成立了一个合作社来销售农产品。

examples.english: Joining a cooperative gave them more control over prices.
examples.chinese: 加入合作社让他们对价格有了更多的掌控。

meanings.definition: Destroy or damage (metal, stone, or other materials) slowly by chemical action.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 通过化学作用逐渐破坏或损害（金属、石材或其他材料）。

examples.english: Salt can corrode metal over time.
examples.chinese: 盐会随着时间腐蚀金属。

examples.english: The pipes corroded and needed to be replaced.
examples.chinese: 管道被腐蚀了，需要更换。

meanings.definition: High respect; great esteem.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 高度尊敬；崇高的敬意。

examples.english: He received an honour for his service to the community.
examples.chinese: 他因对社区的贡献而获得了荣誉。

examples.english: It’s an honour to have you visit our school.
examples.chinese: 非常荣幸你能来访问我们的学校。

meanings.definition: To regard or treat with admiration and respect.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 以钦佩和尊重的态度对待或看待。

examples.english: We honour our ancestors by telling their stories.
examples.chinese: 我们通过讲述祖先的故事来表达敬意。

examples.english: They honoured the fallen soldiers with a ceremony.
examples.chinese: 他们通过仪式来向牺牲的士兵致敬。

meanings.definition: Not including; other than.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 不包括；除此之外。

examples.english: Everyone went to the party except John.
examples.chinese: 除了约翰，所有人都去了派对。

examples.english: They open every day except Sunday.
examples.chinese: 他们每天都营业，周日除外。

meanings.definition: Used before a statement that forms an exception to one just made.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 在先前陈述之后，提出一个例外情况。

examples.english: She would have gone, except she was ill.
examples.chinese: 她本来会去的，但因病而没去。

examples.english: I would help, except I have no free time.
examples.chinese: 我本想帮忙，但我没有空闲时间。
